intro: Chaptalia texana, commonly known as Texas chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the Southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Chaptalia texana is often found in prairie and woodland habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
